glsa.title: Courier Authentication Library: SQL Injection vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: An SQL injection vulnerability has been discovered in the Courier Authentication Library.

background.p: The Courier Authentication Library is a generic authentication API that encapsulates the process of validating account passwords.

description.p: It has been reported that some parameters used in SQL queries are not properly sanitized before being processed when using a non-Latin locale Postgres database.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send specially crafted input to an application using the library, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary SQL commands.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
